(45) 309.28th November, 1945.CABINET.TOURIST ACCOMMODATION COMMITTEE.Memorandum by the Secretary of the Cabinet.IN accordance with the decision of the Cabinet on the 20th November, 1945,*the Prime Minister has appointed a Committee with the following terms ofreference : " To advise and report to the Cabinet on the practicability of usingGovernment hostels, Universities and public schools for the accommodation of tourists, particularly from the United States of America., during 1946."The Committee is composed as follows : Secretary of the Department of Overseas Trade (Chairman).Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State, Foreign Office.Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State, Home Office.Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State, Scottish Office.Parliamentary Secretary, Ministry of Labour and National Service.Parliamentary Secretary, Minister of Education.Parliamentary Secretary, Ministry of Health.Parliamentary Secretary, Ministry of War Transport.Parliamentary Secretary, Ministry of Works..The Secretaries of the Committee are : -Colonel R. P. S. Edwards, Department of Overseas Trade.Mr. J. D. Peel", Cabinet Office.(Signed) E. E. BRIDGES.Cabinet Office, S.W. 1,28th November, 1945,* CM. (45) 54th Conclusions, Minute 5.[30962]
